verses.text: If anyone sins because, after hearing a public call to testify, he is a witness—whether he has seen or learned of the matter—but does not speak, he will bear his guilt.
verses.comment: Reflects legal obligation to testify; retains 'bear his guilt' as per Hebrew idiom.

verses.text: Or if a person touches anything unclean, whether the carcass of an unclean wild animal or of an unclean domestic animal or unclean creeping things, and is unaware, he has become unclean and is guilty when he realizes it.
verses.comment: Modernizes animal categories; 'creeping things' retains biblical term.

verses.text: Or if he touches human uncleanness, whatever kind of uncleanness by which one may become unclean, and it is hidden from him—then, when he learns about it, he is guilty.
verses.comment: Human uncleanness is left general for accuracy.

verses.text: Or if anyone utters rashly with his lips to do evil or to do good, whatever a man might utter rashly with an oath, and it is hidden from him—when he learns of it, he is guilty in one of these.
verses.comment: Retains 'rashly with his lips' reflecting original wording; 'oath' clarified.

verses.text: And it shall be, when he is guilty in any of these matters, that he shall confess what he has sinned.
verses.comment: Short sentence structure to keep close to the Hebrew.

verses.text: He shall bring his guilt offering to the LORD for his sin which he has committed—a female from the flock, either a lamb or a young goat—as a sin offering. And the priest shall make atonement for him regarding his sin.
verses.comment: Keeps gender and species as specified in Hebrew; 'make atonement' relays theological term.

verses.text: But if he cannot afford a sheep, he shall bring, as his guilt offering for that in which he has sinned, two turtledoves or two young pigeons to the LORD—one for a sin offering and the other for a burnt offering.
verses.comment: 'Cannot afford a sheep' accurately reflects economic allowance.

verses.text: He shall bring them to the priest, who shall present first the one that is for the sin offering and wring off its head from its neck, but not sever it completely.
verses.comment: 'Wring off its head…not sever completely' matches sacrificial procedure.

verses.text: He shall sprinkle some of the blood of the sin offering on the side of the altar, and the remainder of the blood shall be drained out at the base of the altar. It is a sin offering.
He shall offer the second bird as a burnt offering according to the ordinance. So the priest shall make atonement for him regarding the sin he has committed, and he shall be forgiven.
verses.comment: 'Ordinance' refers to prescribed ritual; 'be forgiven' is literal.

verses.text: But if he cannot afford two turtledoves or two pigeons, he shall bring as his offering for the sin he has committed a tenth of an ephah of fine flour for a sin offering. He shall not put oil or frankincense upon it, for it is a sin offering.
verses.comment: Clarifies grain measure; no oil/frankincense as per original.

verses.text: He shall bring it to the priest, and the priest shall take a handful as its memorial portion and burn it on the altar, on top of the offerings by fire to the LORD. It is a sin offering.
Thus the priest shall make atonement for him concerning the sin he has committed, any one of these, and he shall be forgiven. And the rest shall be the priest’s, as in the grain offering.
verses.comment: 'The rest shall be the priest’s' matches Hebrew idiom.

verses.text: The LORD spoke to Moses, saying:
verses.comment: Transition sentence; matches formula throughout Leviticus.

verses.text: If anyone commits a breach of faith and sins unintentionally regarding the holy things of the LORD, he shall bring as his guilt offering to the LORD a ram without blemish from the flock, valued in silver by the sanctuary shekel, for a guilt offering.
verses.comment: 'Breach of faith' modernizes 'trespass'; 'sanctuary shekel' kept explicit.

verses.text: He shall make restitution for what he did wrong regarding the holy thing, and shall add a fifth to it and give it to the priest. Then the priest shall make atonement for him with the ram of the guilt offering, and he shall be forgiven.
verses.comment: 'Add a fifth' reflects required restitution percentage.

verses.text: If anyone sins and does what is forbidden in any of the LORD’s commandments, even though he did not know it, he is still guilty and shall bear his punishment.
verses.comment: 'Bear his punishment' matches Hebrew concept of responsibility.

verses.text: He shall bring to the priest a ram without blemish from the flock, according to your estimation, as a guilt offering. The priest shall make atonement for him concerning the matter in which he sinned unknowingly, and he shall be forgiven.
verses.comment: 'According to your estimation' matches Hebrew phrase for value.

verses.text: It is a guilt offering; he has certainly trespassed against the LORD.
verses.comment: 'Certainly trespassed' expresses certainty of guilt as in original.
